title: Electric potential - V at distance D from bar

content.question: Point <math alttext="P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi></math> is located a distance <math alttext="uppercase D" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>D</mi></math> from a thin bar of length <math alttext="L" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>L</mi></math>, as shown in the figure. If the bar has a uniformly distributed net charge per unit length equal to <math alttext="lambda sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>λ</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>, which of the following integrals represents the electric potential at Point <math alttext="P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi></math>? Take the potential to be zero at an infinite distance from the bar.

choices.label: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator 1 and denominator 4 pi epsilon sub 0, end fraction, times the integral from 0 to L, of, the fraction with numerator lambda sub 0, end sub, lowercase d x, and denominator uppercase D" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mrow><mn>4</mn><mi>π</mi><msub><mi>ε</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></mrow></mfrac><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msubsup><mo>∫</mo><mn>0</mn><mi>L</mi></msubsup><mfrac><mrow><msub><mi>λ</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mi>d</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow><mi>D</mi></mfrac></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator 1 and denominator 4 pi epsilon sub 0, end fraction, times the integral from 0 to L, of, the fraction with numerator lambda sub 0, end sub, lowercase d x, and denominator the square root of, x squared plus uppercase D squared, end root, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mrow><mn>4</mn><mi>π</mi><msub><mi>ε</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></mrow></mfrac><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msubsup><mo>∫</mo><mn>0</mn><mi>L</mi></msubsup><mfrac><mrow><msub><mi>λ</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mi>d</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow><msqrt><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mi>D</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></msqrt></mfrac></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator 1 and denominator 4 pi epsilon sub 0, end fraction, times the integral from 0 to L, of, the fraction with numerator lambda sub 0, end sub, lowercase d x, and denominator the square root of open parenthesis, x minus L, close parenthesis, squared, plus uppercase D squared, end root, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mrow><mn>4</mn><mi>π</mi><msub><mi>ε</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></mrow></mfrac><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msubsup><mo>∫</mo><mn>0</mn><mi>L</mi></msubsup><mfrac><mrow><msub><mi>λ</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mi>d</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow><msqrt><msup><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mi>L</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mi>D</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></msqrt></mfrac></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator 1 and denominator 4 pi epsilon sub 0, end fraction, times the integral from 0 to L, of, the fraction with numerator lambda sub 0, end sub, lowercase d x, and denominator the square root of open parenthesis, x minus the fraction L over 2, close parenthesis, squared, plus uppercase D squared, end root, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mrow><mn>4</mn><mi>π</mi><msub><mi>ε</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></mrow></mfrac><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msubsup><mo>∫</mo><mn>0</mn><mi>L</mi></msubsup><mfrac><mrow><msub><mi>λ</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mi>d</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow><msqrt><msup><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mi>L</mi><mo>/</mo><mn>2</mn></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mi>D</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></msqrt></mfrac></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator 1 and denominator 4 pi epsilon sub 0, end fraction, times the integral from 0 to L, of, the fraction with numerator lambda sub 0, end sub, lowercase d x, and denominator the square root of open parenthesis, x minus the fraction L over 2, close parenthesis, squared, plus uppercase D squared, end root, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mrow><mn>4</mn><mi>π</mi><msub><mi>ε</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></mrow></mfrac><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msubsup><mo>∫</mo><mn>0</mn><mi>L</mi></msubsup><mfrac><mrow><msub><mi>λ</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mi>d</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow><msqrt><msup><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mi>L</mi><mo>/</mo><mn>2</mn></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mi>D</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></msqrt></mfrac></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
